Acolyte: I idolize a particular hero of my faith, and constantly refer to that person's deeds and example.
Charlatan: I fall in and out of love easily, and am always pursuing someone.
Criminal: I always have a plan for when things go wrong.
Entertainer: I know a story relevant to almost every situation.
Folk Hero: I judge people by their actions, not their words.
Guild Artisan: I believe that anything worth doing is worth doing right. I can't help it—I'm a perfectionist.
Hermit: I've been isolated for so long that I rarely speak, preferring gestures and the occasional grunt.
Noble: My eloquent flattery makes everyone I talk to feel like the most wonderful and important person in the world.
Outlander: I'm driven by a wanderlust that led me away from home.
Sage: I use polysyllabic words that convey the impression of great erudition.
Sailor: My friends know they can rely on me, no matter what.
Urchin: I hide scraps of food and trinkets away in my pockets.

Acolyte: I can find common ground between the fiercest enemies, empathizing with them and always working toward peace.
Charlatan: I have a joke for every occasion, especially occasions where humor is inappropriate.
Criminal: I am always calm, no matter what the situation. I never raise my voice or let my emotions control me.
Entertainer: Whenever I come to a new place, I collect local rumors and spread gossip.
Folk Hero: If someone is in trouble, I'm always ready to lend help.
Guild Artisan: I'm a snob who looks down on those who can't appreciate fine art.
Hermit: I am utterly serene, even in the face of disaster.
Noble: The common folk love me for my kindness and generosity.
Outlander: I watch over my friends as if they were a litter of newborn pups.
Sage: I've read every book in the world's greatest libraries—or I like to boast that I have.
Sailor: I work hard so that I can play hard when the work is done.
Soldier: I'm haunted by memories of war. I can't get the images of violence out of my mind.
Urchin: I ask a lot of questions.

Acolyte: I see omens in every event and action. The gods try to speak to us, we just need to listen.
Charlatan: Flattery is my preferred trick for getting what I want.
Criminal: The first thing I do in a new place is note the locations of everything valuable—or where such things could be hidden.
Entertainer: I'm a hopeless romantic, always searching for that "special someone".
Folk Hero: When I set my mind to something, I follow through no matter what gets in my way.
Guild Artisan: I always want to know how things work and what makes people tick.
Hermit: The leader of my community had something wise to say on every topic, and I am eager to share that wisdom.
Noble: No one could doubt by looking at my regal bearing that I am a cut above the unwashed masses.
Outlander: I once ran twenty-five miles without stopping to warn to my clan of an approaching orc horde. I'd do it again if I had to.
Sage: I'm used to helping out those who aren't as smart as I am, and I patiently explain anything and everything to others.
Sailor: I enjoy sailing into new ports and making new friends over a flagon of ale.
Soldier: I've lost too many friends, and I'm slow to make new ones.
Urchin: I like to squeeze into small places where no one else can get to me.

Acolyte: Nothing can shake my optimistic attitude.
Charlatan: I'm a born gambler who can't resist taking a risk for a potential payoff.
Criminal: I would rather make a new friend than a new enemy.
Entertainer: Nobody stays angry at me or around me for long, since I can defuse any amount of tension.
Folk Hero: I have a strong sense of fair play and always try to find the most equitable solution to arguments.
Guild Artisan: I'm full of witty aphorisms and have a proverb for every occasion.
Hermit: I feel tremendous empathy for all who suffer.
Noble: I take great pains to always look my best and follow the latest fashions.
Outlander: I have a lesson for every situation, drawn from observing nature.
Sage: There's nothing I like more than a good mystery.
Sailor: I stretch the truth for the sake of a good story.
Soldier: I'm full of inspiring and cautionary tales from my military experience relevant to almost every combat situation.
Urchin: I sleep with my back to a wall or tree, with everything I own wrapped in a bundle in my arms.

Acolyte: I quote (or misquote) sacred texts and proverbs in almost every situation.
Charlatan: I lie about almost everything, even when there's no reason to.
Criminal: I am incredibly slow to trust. Those who seem the fairest often have the most to hide.
Entertainer: I love a good insult, even one directed at me.
Folk Hero: I'm confident in my own abilities and do what I can to instill confidence in others.
Guild Artisan: I'm rude to people who lack my commitment to hard work and fair play.
Hermit: I'm oblivious to etiquette and social expectations.
Noble: I don't like to get my hands dirty, and I won't be caught dead in unsuitable accommodations.
Outlander: I place no stock in wealthy or well-mannered folk. Money and manners won't save you from a hungry owlbear.
Sage: I'm willing to listen to every side of an argument before I make my own judgment.
Sailor: To me, a tavern brawl is a nice way to get to know a new city.
Soldier: I can stare down a hell hound without flinching.
Urchin: I eat like a pig and have bad manners.

Acolyte: I am tolerant (or intolerant) of other faiths and respect (or condemn) the worship of other gods.
Charlatan: Sarcasm and insults are my weapons of choice.
Criminal: I don't pay attention to the risks in a situation. Never tell me the odds.
Entertainer: I get bitter if I'm not the center of attention.
Folk Hero: Thinking is for other people. I prefer action.
Guild Artisan: I like to talk at length about my profession.
Hermit: I connect everything that happens to me to a grand, cosmic plan.
Noble: Despite my noble birth, I do not place myself above other folk. We all have the same blood.
Outlander: I'm always picking things up, absently fiddling with them, and sometimes accidentally breaking them.
Sage: I... speak... slowly... when talking... to idiots,... which... almost... everyone... is... compared... to me.
Sailor: I never pass up a friendly wager.
Soldier: I enjoy being strong and like breaking things.
Urchin: I think anyone who's nice to me is hiding evil intent.

Acolyte: I've enjoyed fine food, drink, and high society among my temple's elite. Rough living grates on me.
Charlatan: I keep multiple holy symbols on me and invoke whatever deity might come in useful at any given moment.
Criminal: The best way to get me to do something is to tell me I can't do it.
Entertainer: I'll settle for nothing less than perfection.
Folk Hero: I misuse long words in an attempt to sound smarter.
Guild Artisan: I don't part with my money easily and will haggle tirelessly to get the best deal possible.
Hermit: I often get lost in my own thoughts and contemplation, becoming oblivious to my surroundings.
Noble: My favor, once lost, is lost forever.
Outlander: I feel far more comfortable around animals than people.
Sage: I am horribly, horribly awkward in social situations.
Sailor: My language is as foul as an otyugh nest.
Soldier: I have a crude sense of humor.

Acolyte: I've spent so long in the temple that I have little practical experience dealing with people in the outside world.
Charlatan: I pocket anything I see that might have some value.
Criminal: I blow up at the slightest insult.
Entertainer: I change my mood or my mind as quickly as I change key in a song.
Folk Hero: I get bored easily. When am I going to get on with my destiny?
Guild Artisan: I'm well known for my work, and I want to make sure everyone appreciates it. I'm always taken aback when people haven't heard of me.
Hermit: I am working on a grand philosophical theory and love sharing my ideas.
Noble: If you do me an injury, I will crush you, ruin your name, and salt your fields.
Outlander: I was, in fact, raised by wolves.
Sage: I'm convinced that people are always trying to steal my secrets.
Sailor: I like a job well done, especially if I can convince someone else to do it.
Soldier: I face problems head-on. A simple, direct solution is the best path to success.
Urchin: I bluntly say what others are hinting at or hiding.
